arts.ttl: Liam Manning infuriated after Ashton Gate penalty incident in Bristol City loss vs Burnley
arts.sum: City had plenty of chances to secure a point, the best of which fell to Yu Hirakawa midway through the second half when the Japanese winger could only pick out James Trafford from close range after getting on the end of an excellent pass from Max Bird. The best chance of the game, however, was Hirakawa's second-half effort and although Manning was keen to praise Trafford's positioning between the posts, he admitted he felt that the Japanese winger's first touch had left him with far too much work to do in the visitor's penalty area.

arts.ttl: Bristol City player ratings v Burnley: Midfielders stand out as forwards rue wasted chances
arts.sum: Bristol City Live is now on WhatsApp and we want you to join our community. The former Burnley man started on the left of City's back three and didn't look particularly comfortable in or out of possession.

arts.ttl: Burnley player ratings from Bristol City win with two lively 8s and a wasteful 6
arts.sum: Burnley player ratings from their win at Championship rivals Bristol City on Saturday afternoon.

arts.ttl: Championship roundup: Burnley beat Bristol City as Blades held to a draw
arts.sum: Managerless Coventry twice come from behind to draw Cardiff and Sheffield Wednesday share the points in a 1-1 Jaidon Anthony’s first-half strike proved enough for Burnley to take three points from a 1-0 victory over Bristol City in a rousing Championship battle at Ashton Gate. The winning goal came on 23 minutes when Anthony found the roof of the net with a close-range shot after Max O’Leary had dived full length to palm a Josh Brownhill shot into his path. Burnley were the better side for an hour, but had to withstand a fired-up finale from the home side, who came close to rescuing a point and claimed to be denied a clear penalty late on when a free-kick into the box skidded on to Brownhill’s arm. arts.sum: Jaidon Anthony's first-half strike proved enough for Burnley to take three points from a 1-0 victory over Bristol City in a rousing Championship battle at Ashton Gate.

arts.ttl: Scott Parker makes two big calls as Burnley team confirmed for Bristol City clash

arts.ttl: Bristol City predicted team vs Burnley as Liam Manning faces new defensive selection headache
arts.sum: Bristol City look set to head into their Ashton Gate showdown with promotion-chasing Burnley with much of the same squad that secured all three points against Norwich City before the international break. Manning’s options at right-back remain light with it still unclear whether or not Mark Sykes will be ready to return to the fold against Scott Parker’s side and it may be too early for Scott Twine to step back into the starting line-up with the former Burnley only doing bits and pieces of training in the international break.

arts.ttl: Every word Liam Manning said on Bristol City v Burnley, Rob Atkinson, pathway, schedule and more
arts.sum: The lads will be joining in with the session and I’ll be watching a bit of it so it’s great to get out in the community, interact with fans and see some of the terrific work that’s going on. We want to be aggressive, on the front foot, hit the level that we know we’re capable of, and give everything and that’s the biggest bit the lads have done recently and throughout most of the season so far is be all in on everything and I think you’ve seen that.
